meanings.definition: A person who imitates the style or language of ancient Greek literature.
meanings.sent1: The atticist enjoyed writing in the ancient Greek style.
meanings.sent2: She was known as an atticist for her love of imitating ancient Greek literature.
meanings.sent3: The atticist's friends teased him about always speaking like he was from ancient Greece.
meanings.sent4: Her writing was like a time machine, transporting readers back to the atticist era.
meanings.sent5: The atticist's passion for ancient Greek literature was contagious.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the style or language of ancient Greek literature.
meanings.sent1: The atticist language class focused on ancient Greek styles.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed many atticist artifacts from ancient Greece.
meanings.sent3: Her atticist-themed party was a hit among her friends.
meanings.sent4: The atticist decor in the room made it feel like stepping into ancient Greece.
meanings.sent5: The atticist influence could be seen in the architecture of the building.
